intro: Tridactyle verrucosa, commonly known as the rough tridactyle, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, hairy, and often spiny leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or shrubland habitats. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
